text:
Ford is a city in Ford County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 216 people lived there.
History.
Ford was created in about 1885. It was named after Col. James Hobart Ford.
The first post office in Ford was built in February 1885.
Geography.
Ford is at (37.635977, -99.753013). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
In 2010, there were 216 people, 96 households, and 59 families living in Ford. The population density was. 87.0% of the people were White, 0.5% were African American, 3.7% were Native American, 6.9% were from other races, and 1.9% were from two or more races. 8.3% of the people were Hispanic or Latino of any race.
2000 census.
In 2000, there were 314 people, 111 households, and 87 families living in Ford. The population density was 748.3 people per square mile (288.7/km²).
Education.
Ford is a part of USD 459 Bucklin. The Bucklin High School mascot is Bucklin Red Aces.
Ford High School was closed because of school unification. The Ford Bulldogs won the Kansas State High School boys class BB Track & Field championship in 1964 and 1966.
